intro: Wendlandia, commonly known as the "blue mist flower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to South America, particularly the Andes region. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Wendlandia species are valued in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
